Make&Model

CEO, Make&Model
2017 - Present

As the Founder and CEO of Make&Model, I spearheaded a team in executing innovative projects across various domains, notably achieving an Emmy award for one of our clients. I have established myself as a leader adept at fostering innovation and collaboration. My greatest accomplishments at Make&Model lie in creating an agency that not only attracts diverse and complex projects but also positively impacts society and the environment. I have cultivated a versatile team skilled in transforming intricate challenges into user-friendly solutions, thereby building Make&Model's reputation as a transformative force in design and technology.

Achievements

  • Team Building and Project Excellence
    • Spearheaded the formation and development of a high-performing team specializing in product experience design, brand design, content strategy, and technology development.
    • Consistently delivered industry-leading projects, maintaining a 100% client satisfaction rate within scope and budget.
  • Leadership During Adversity
    • Successfully navigated the company through the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, ensuring business continuity and team well-being.
    • Adapted business strategies to overcome pandemic-related hurdles, maintaining operational stability and securing vital funding through the PPP program.
  • Diverse Client Portfolio and Project Delivery
    • Played a key role in acquiring and servicing over 50 diverse clients across sectors such as healthcare, education, fitness, environmental sustainability, grocery retail, end-of-life planning, AI & ML development, and philanthropy.
    • Led multi-disciplinary project teams to deliver tailored solutions that consistently met varied client needs and expectations.
  • Business Growth and Financial Achievement
    • Drove the company's growth from its inception to an established entity, achieving annual revenues nearing $1 million with a lean team of five full-time employees.
    • Implemented effective business strategies and operational efficiencies that contributed to sustainable growth and financial health.

Customer Success

  • Imperfect Foods: I collaborated with my design team during a growth phase to revitalize the design and content of their marketing website, e-commerce design patterns, and later developed a 5 year visual product roadmap, contributing to a kinder, less wasteful world. Our work led to a 17% decrease in cancellations, a 20-30% decrease in first order bounces, and a 10-12% increase in first and second average order value. ⟶ Case study
  • CVision: I directed the design of an open-source software experience for marine biologists to transform huge volumes of oceanic footage into meaningful data for AI training, which would at times used for piloting autonomous underwater vehicles. CVision was funded by NOAA and later lead to our work with MBARI (below). Their training and reporting product is now the standard for AI-driven oceanic research. ⟶ Case study
  • Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute: Following the creation of CVision's product, I directed the creation of FathomNet, a tool utilized by the marine sciences community for sharing and exploring oceanographic data, as well as aiding in research and education in understanding the marine environment. Think about it as a public database alike iNaturalist for the marine environment. This tool is now utilized by research institutes across the world to unite and improve their observational datasets. ⟶ Case study
  • National Association of Independent Schools: In a series of engagements with NAIS, I orchestrated the delivery of their new Market View, DASL, and Compensation Explorer products. Their focus is to allow folks in the business of running independent schools to better assess the trends of their addressable market as well as their spend on attaining new students, to compare and understand performance differences between schools, and to assure appropriately competitive compensation for employees. ⟶ Case study
  • Better Place Forests: A past client who joined BPF as their CMO had asked me to bring in my team to “upcycle” their brand, to reconsider their entire marketing site content strategy, and to deliver an e-commerce experience designed to help make end-of-life planning more approachable, affordable, and environmentally sound. The relationship proved to be a huge success, enabling their expansion into midwest and eastern forests, and reducing decision friction and the difficulty around discussing death. ⟶ Case study
  • CareerVillage: I performed many duties in our partnership with CareerVillage. I directed the design, development, and much of the operations behind producing their current product experience. CareerVillage helps youth get access to career advise they would normally have no clear means of attaining.
    “Steven was extraordinary both as a Design leader and as a Product leader. Our progress was faster, our site was better, and our users were happier when we hired Steven than they'd ever been before. And he's set a direction for us that has stood the test of time. His impact on our work, and on our users, absolutely can NOT be overstated. I strongly recommend Steven in any context where clarity of thought and consistency of execution is the key to success.” - by Jared Chung, CEO of CareerVillage ⟶ Case study

Other Experience

Director of Design, Mariana Tek
2016 - 2017

After working with the founders of Flywheel Sports, formerly a top competitive spin cycling studio with locations around the world, to redefine their in-studio spinning experience and later managing the team running design sprints that would lead to their new product, I had joined their new venture Mariana Tek as their Director of Design. During my time there I directly contributed on product design, user research, usability testing, and paved the way forward for this new team to bring the product to an international market.

Partner & Creative Director, DockYard
2013 - 2016

In selling Dobot, I joined DockYard as Partner and Creative Director, eventually co-leading a team of nine designers and twelve engineers. We completed multi-million dollar projects for clients like McGraw Hill Education, NASDAQ, Society of Grownups/Mass Mutual, IDEO, Flywheel Sports, and America's Test Kitchen. After overseeing the team expansion and training my successor, I resigned to embark on a journey to explore the concept of a socially conscious studio, which eventually materialized as Make&Model.

Founder, Dobot
2012 - 2013

My second business was a Cambridge, MA-based boutique design and illustration studio. I led the creation of interactive animated web comics, organized pillar Boston design events, and art-directed animations, photoshoots, and music videos. Additionally, we performed product design services, ranging from innovative in-store shopping experiences to software for new wifi-first cellular devices.

Sr. Designer & Front-end Developer, CustomMade
2010 - 2012

As the sole designer and front-end developer, I rapidly designed and launched features in weekly sprints, focusing on iteration and delivery. This experience significantly enhanced my skills in product team collaboration, understanding trade-offs, patience, and determination.

Sr. Designer & Front-end Developer, Fuzz Productions
2008 - 2010

In my first post-college role, I worked extensively, laying the groundwork for my career in design, development, and entrepreneurship. At Fuzz, I designed notable iPhone apps for Condé Nast and the pioneering UGuideMe tour guide system. My responsibilities included redesigning and developing websites for banks, schools, and artists, along with managing client relations. This demanding role tested everything I knew, but my background in print and information technology equipped me to handle the challenging trade-offs and client negotiations.
